Definition: RMS of wave input power to WEC (scaled), averaged over analysis window.
Notes: Pin(t) in kW; computed on resampled common grid.

Definition: RMS of PTO electrical generation power (full-scale), over analysis window.
Notes: Ppto(t) in kW; computed on resampled common grid.

Definition: RMS of transmission power loss (full-scale), over analysis window.
Notes: Ploss(t) in kW; computed on resampled common grid.

Definition: RMS of delivered power after transmission: Pdel = Ppto - Ploss.
Notes: Delivered power excludes modeled transmission loss only.

Definition: RMS-based efficiency from wave input to delivered power.
Notes: Use RMS metric for steady/periodic comparisons.

Definition: Energy-based efficiency from wave input to delivered energy.
Notes: Energy metric is preferred for irregular seas / nonstationary signals.

Definition: RMS-based transmission loss fraction relative to PTO power.
Notes: Higher value means higher fraction lost in transmission.

Definition: Energy-based transmission loss fraction relative to PTO energy.
Notes: Energy fraction is less sensitive to waveform shape than RMS.

Definition: Pearson correlation coefficient between Pin(t) and Ppto(t).
Notes: Close to 1 indicates strong tracking; negative indicates inverse relation.

Definition: Estimated time lag (seconds) where Ppto best aligns with Pin via cross-correlation.
Notes: Positive lag means Ppto lags Pin; depends on control & dynamics.
